findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 4 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including 0 critical and 4 high severity. Temporally verified against payment dates.

findings.label: Likely Duplicate Payments
findings.detail: 1311 high-confidence duplicate groups with same supplier, amount, date and reference number

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 777 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week

findings.label: Round-Number Payments (>£5K)
findings.detail: 774 exact round-number payments over £5,000 — may indicate estimates rather than invoiced amounts

findings.label: Year-End Spending Spike
findings.detail: Financial Services spent 2.7x their monthly average in March — potential year-end budget rush worth £1.7M above normal

key_findings.title: Marston (Holdings) Ltd: £17.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments

key_findings.title: Jewson Ltd: £17.0K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments

key_findings.title: Auto Match Ltd: £3.4K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Confirmation statement overdue; Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments

key_findings.title: FUELMATE LTD: 5047 transactions totalling £800.2K
key_findings.description: Averaging £159 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier

key_findings.title: 44 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £40.2M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services

key_findings.title: WALTON SUMMIT TRUCK CENTRE LTD: 115237% price gap between councils
